title: Boaters: Small Craft Advisory is in effect until 3 pm on Thursday, December 1.
description: The Nat. Weather Service has issued a Small Craft Advisory for coastal waters between Point Arena and Point Reyes, including Tomales Bay. Winds of 21–33 knots (24–38 mph) and/or steep waves are expected to produce hazardous wave conditions to small craft.

title: What's Closed, and What's Open This Week? —Thursday, December 1, 2022
description: Coconino County is in CDC MEDIUM Community Level —Face Masks Are Not Required indoors, however physical distancing is encouraged indoors. South Rim Visitor Center is open 10 am to 4 pm. Visit link for updated hours. NORTH RIM HAS CLOSED FOR THE WINTER!

title: The North Rim has Closed for the Winter —Thursday, December 1, 2022
description: The North Rim will open for the 2023 season on May 15. Lodging reservations are recommended. Campground reservations are required.

title: Winter Closures
description: The access road to Telescope Peak trailhead is closed beyond the Charcoal Kilns, due to snowy conditions. Many other roads remain closed due to damage and debris from major flooding this summer. Click 'more' for a map and detailed information.

title: Expect delays during road work on CA-190
description: Dec. 5-9, and Dec. 12-16, 6am-4:30pm, expect delays of up to 2 hours on CA-190 between Emigrant Junction and Panamint Valley Junction

title: Kohm Yah-Mah-Nee Visitor Center Closed
description: The Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center will be closed on Thursday December first due to inclement weather.

title: Winter Storm Warning
description: A Winter storm warning is in effect November 30th starting at 10 pm. through 10 a.m. Friday night. Heavy snow and high winds expected. The Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center will be closed on December 1st due to inclement weather.

title: Lehman Caves closed in January/February 2023
description: Lehman Cave tours will be unavailable in January and February of 2023 due to several cave rehabilitation and improvement projects. Tours will resume March 1st, 2023 and can be reserved 30 days in advance. More information: https://go.nps.gov/LehmanCaves

title: Museum and Visitor Center Winter Hours Take Effect December 1, 2022
description: Museum and Visitor Center Winter Hours take effect December 1, 2022. From December 1, 2022, to February 28, 2023, building hours are 9 am to 4 pm.

title: Parking Lot Will Not Be Plowed on Weekends
description: Craters of the Moon will not be plowing the visitor center parking lot until we reopen for the winter season on Jan 27, 2023.

title: Winter Storm will affect Craters of the Moon through Friday Dec 2
description: Please be advised that a winter storm will bring snowfall accumulations of up to 18 inches Dec 1-3. Please use caution and consider changing travel plans.

title: Hanford Visitor Center Closed
description: Hanford Visitor Center will be closed Thursday, Dec. 1, and will reopen at 9 am on Friday, Dec. 2.

title: January 1, to January 14, 2023
description: The Home of Franklin D. Roosevelt and the Vanderbilt Mansion will close for 2 weeks. We will re-open on Sunday, January 15th. The grounds will remain open every day. The FDR Library & Museum will remain open as well.

title: Wednesday, December 14th
description: The last tour at the Home of FDR will be 2:00 PM.

title: Phones Down at Chickamauga Battlefield
description: Unfortunately, the park's phones are currently down at Chickamauga Battlefield. If you are trying to reach someone and have an alternate way to make contact, please use that method. You may also use the "Contact Us" link at the bottom of this page.

title: Be Prepared to Carry Tire Chains Starting Thursday, December 1
description: With snow expected at the elevation of the sequoia groves, tire chain requirements may be in effect. For current road conditions, call (559) 565-3341, and press 1, then 1.

title: Entrance station closed on 12/1
description: The park entrance station at 171 Shoreline Drive will be closed on 12/1. This will not impede entering and visiting the park. Follow the link below to pay your park entrance fee online.

title: Early Park Closure Today
description: Due to heavy wind and tide conditions in the harbor, the park will be closing two hours early today (Nov. 30). The last ferry off of Liberty Island will be at 3 PM and the last ferry off Ellis Island at 3:15 PM.

title: Early Park Closure Today
description: Due to heavy wind and tide conditions in the harbor, the park will be closing two hours early today (Nov. 30). The last ferry off of Liberty Island will be at 3 PM and the last ferry off Ellis Island at 3:15 PM.

title: Echo, Hole in the Wall and Cottonwood/Marble now open- Roadside camping permit required
description: Echo Canyon, Hole in the Wall and Cottonwood/Marble Roads have reopened. A free permit is now required to camp along these roads. No permit is required for day use. Click below for more information.

title: Current Detour on the Natchez Trace Parkway
description: Follow orange detour signs. Parkway is closed between south of Colbert Ferry, AL (mp 326) and Tishomingo State Park, MS (mp 303). There may be one-lane closures on the TN River John Coffee Memorial Bridge. Click "more" below for map. Bike camp is open.

title: Construction closure of Sea Camp Campground Bathhouse
description: The park is updating the bathhouse at Sea Camp Campground. Temporary bathrooms and showers have been installed. A portion of the trail will be closed and re-routed. All visitors must follow posted detour signs. Walk bicycles through campground loop.

title: Visitor Center Closed for town Christmas Parade on December 4
description: The park Visitor Center will close at 1pm on Sunday, December 4 for staff to participate in the Middletown Christmas Parade.

title: COVID-19 Masking Guidance
description: The park continues to monitor the CDC's community level for COVID-19. When that level is at HIGH, masks will be required in the visitor center.

title: COVID-19 Masking Guidance
description: The park continues to monitor the CDC's community level for COVID-19. When that level is at HIGH, masks will be required in the visitor center.

title: Shiloh Visitor Center Closure
description: As of Monday, November 28, the Shiloh Battlefield visitor center is closed to install new museum exhibits. The movie is still being shown in the auditorium, please enter through marked side door. Restrooms are available in the visitor center parking lot.

title: Winter Storm Warning in Effect Thursday 12/1 - Friday 12/2
description: Heavy snow is expected, with gusty winds and snowfall totals of near 2 feet in the mountains. If you're not experienced with driving in mountain storms, consider visiting at another time. For current road conditions, call (559) 565-3341 (press 1, then 1)

title: COVID-19 Masking Advisory
description: The park continues to monitor the CDC's community level for COVID-19. When that level is at HIGH, masks will be required in the visitor center.

title: Holiday Visitors Please Note
description: The Frijoles Canyon section of Bandelier will be closed on Christmas Day, December 25, 2022, including the visitor center, Main Pueblo Loop Trail, Falls Trail, and other trails that originate in the canyon. All will be open normal hours on New Year's Day.

title: Longmire to Paradise 2022-23 Winter Road Access Closure Mondays-Fridays
description: The winter of 2022-23, public access to Paradise is limited to Saturdays and Sundays, weather/staff/equipment dependent. Due to staffing shortages the park does not have the capacity to maintain public access 7 day/week.

title: Winter Weather
description: Due to snowfall and winter weather park roads, trails, walkways, cave entrances and parking areas may be icy and have snow covering them. Please travel carefully and watch your footing when hiking or caving.

title: Temporary Nighttime Road Closures for Deer Management
description: From November 22, 2022 to March 31, 2023, the NPS may temporarily close select park roads between 5 p.m. to 4 a.m. to conduct deer management operations. Per the Rock Creek Park Superintendent’s Compendium, trails and other park areas close at sunset.

title: December 2022 Tours at Eisenhower NHS
description: Visitors coming to Eisenhower NHS for Christmas tours of the Eisenhower home are reminded to dress for the elements as most of the tour takes place outdoors. Information on tour times and how to visit can be found through this link:

title: Alert - Seasonal Closures
description: The Coyote Loop of Juniper Family Campground and the RV Dump Station will be closed until late spring 2023.

title: Otero County is in a High COVID-19 Community Level - Masks are required in NPS buildings
description: The CDC has identified Otero County, where Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site is located, as a High COVID-19 Community Level. Masks are required for everyone in all National Park Service buildings, regardless of vaccination status.

title: Bridge "J" Out on Kingsnake Trail
description: Bridge "J" is out on Kingsnake Trail. Do not attempt to cross.

title: Do Not Feed or Touch Wildlife
description: Wildlife accustomed to being fed will become aggressive to obtain food. This includes coyote and fox. There have been serious incidents involving bites to people and pets. Report injured or deceased wildlife to park staff. Never touch injured wildlife.

title: Melrose Mansion Guided Tours
description: Guided tours of the Melrose mansion are available to the first ten people who sign up for each tour at the site's visitor center. Tours start at 9, 10, 11, 2, 3, and 4; and masks are optional. Melrose is temporarily closed on Tuesdays.

title: Mauna Loa is closed
description: Mauna Loa is closed due to an eruption that began on 11/27/22. Mauna Loa Road is closed to vehicles from Kīpukapuaulu and closed to pedestrians and bikes from the first cattle guard. The closure extends to the summit caldera. Main park areas remain open.

title: Road Closures
description: The South Rim Road beyond the Visitor Center is closed for the season. The East Portal and North Rim Roads are closed for the season.

title: Road to Rim Village Temporarily CLOSED.
description: The road from Park Headquarters to Rim Village is temporarily CLOSED due to heavy snow. There is currently no projection on when it will reopen.

title: Medano Pass Primitive Road Closed for Winter at Castle Creek Picnic Area
description: Medano Pass Primitive Road is CLOSED for the winter season at Castle Creek Picnic Area (2.6 miles from the southern entrance of the road). This is a backcountry road that does NOT affect travel to the dunes or main use area of the park.

title: Park Unit Closures and Reopenings
description: The Prairie Acadian Cultural Center in Eunice is closed. However, this site does have some outdoor programs. See the Calendar for event information. Some trails at the Barataria Preserve remain closed. Click "more" below for further information.

title: Wharf Restrooms Closed - Nov 29 & 30
description: Due to work on the restroom floors, the wharf restrooms will be closed at times on Tuesday, November 29 and Wednesday, November 30.

title: Masks Currently Required in Park Buildings
description: Alamosa County is currently in HIGH transmission rate for Covid-19. Masks are required for everyone in all NPS buildings regardless of vaccination status.

title: Tour Road Area Closed Monday - Friday
description: The Tour Road is now closed to vehicles for winter. It is open for pedestrian and bicycle use weekends only as construction continues on the Tour Road Improvement Project. We will announce the return to the usual winter schedule when construction ends.

title: Washington Monument closed one day a month for maintenance
description: The Washington Monument is closed on Dec. 1.

title: One-way traffic in Lower Town 12/3 -12/4
description: Traffic flow in historic Lower Town will be modified from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. on 12/3 and 12/4. Follow the link for closure and rerouting information.

title: Park Entrance Fee Increase
description: Park entrance fees will increase beginning January 1, 2023. See the park fee webpage for more information.

title: Park Closure - Christmas Holiday
description: The park will be closed December 26, 2022, in observance of the Christmas Holiday and will re-open on Tuesday, December 27, 2022, at our regularly scheduled time, 9:00am -5:00pm. The first tour starts at 10:00am and the last tour of the day is 4:00pm.
